arabicText: ۞ وَمَآ أُبَرِّئُ نَفْسِىٓ ۚ إِنَّ ٱلنَّفْسَ لَأَمَّارَةٌۢ بِٱلسُّوٓءِ إِلَّا مَا رَحِمَ رَبِّىٓ ۚ إِنَّ رَبِّى غَفُورٌۭ رَّحِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
“And	 I	 do	 not	 portray	my	 soul	 as	innocent;	
undoubtedly	the	soul	excessively	commands	
towards	evil,	except	upon	whom	my	Lord	has	
mercy;	indeed	my	Lord	is Oft	Forgiving,	Most	
Merciful.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	maiñ	apne	nafs	ko	be	qusoor	nahiñ	batātā	
be-shak	 nafs	 to	 burāi	 kā	 badā	 hukm	 dene	
wālā	hai	magar	jis	par	merā	rab	rahem		kare	
be-shak		merā	rab	bakhsh	ne	wālā	meherbān		
hai

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلْمَلِكُ ٱئْتُونِى بِهِۦٓ أَسْتَخْلِصْهُ لِنَفْسِى ۖ فَلَمَّا كَلَّمَهُۥ قَالَ إِنَّكَ ٱلْيَوْمَ لَدَيْنَا مَكِينٌ أَمِينٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	king	said,	“Bring	him	to	me	so	that	
I	 may	 choose	 him	 especially	 for	 myself”;	
and	 when	 he	 had	 talked	 to	 him	 he	 said,	
“Indeed	 you	 are	 today,	 before	 us,	 the	
honourable,	the	trusted.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	bādshāh	bolā	unheñ	mere	pās	le	āao	ke	
unheñ	khās	apne	liye	chun	looñ	phir	jab	us	se	
bāt	 ki	 kahā	 be-shak	 āaj	 āap	 hamāre	 yahāñ	
mu’azzaz	mo’atamad	haiñ

arabicText: قَالَ ٱجْعَلْنِى عَلَىٰ خَزَآئِنِ ٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ إِنِّى حَفِيظٌ عَلِيمٌۭ ٥٥
englishTranslationText:
Said	Yusuf,	“Appoint	me	over	the	treasures	
of	 the	 earth;	 indeed	 I	 am	 a	 protector,	
knowledgeable.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yūsufne	kahā	mujhe	zameen	ke	khazānoñ	par	
kar	 de	 be-shak	 	maiñ	 hifāzat	wālā	ìlm	wālā	
hooñ

arabicText: وَكَذَٰلِكَ مَكَّنَّا لِيُوسُفَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ يَتَبَوَّأُ مِنْهَا حَيْثُ يَشَآءُ ۚ نُصِيبُ بِرَحْمَتِنَا مَن نَّشَآءُ ۖ وَلَا نُضِيعُ أَجْرَ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	this	is	how	We	gave	Yusuf	the	control	
over	 that	 land;	 to	 stay	 in	 it	 wherever	 he	
pleased;	 We	 may	 convey	 Our	 mercy	 to	
whomever	We	 will,	 and	We	 do	 not	 waste	
the	wages	of	the	righteous.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 yuñ	 hi	 Ham ne	 Yūsuf ko	 us	 mulk	 par	
qudrat	 bakhshi	 us	 meiñ	 jahāñ	 chāhe	 rahe	
ham	 apni	Rahmat	jise	 chāheñ	 pahuñchāyeñ	
aur	ham	nekoñ	kā	neg	(Ajr)	zāye	nahiñ	karte

arabicText: وَلَأَجْرُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ خَيْرٌۭ لِّلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَكَانُوا۟ يَتَّقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 undoubtedly	 the	 reward	 of	 the	
Hereafter	 is	 better,	 for	 those	 who	 accept	
faith	and	remain	pious.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 be-shak	 āakhirat	 kā	 sawāb	 un	 ke	 liye	
behtar	hai	jo	Imān lāye	aur	parhezgār	rahe
